page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The only substantial block of housing in our area is the village of Canonbie. It is situated in the Scottish borders about 14 miles north of Carlisle. The river Esk runs down the east side of the village. On the East bank of the Esk is a small church, a school and a cluster of modern bungalows. On the west side is the main village, comprising of mixed council, Buccleuch Estate , and private hpusing, two hotels, and three shops. The rest of the land in our block is farmland, mostly pasture, devoted to stock rearing and dairying. There are two small hamlets at Claygate and Hollows. At Hollows there is a fine example of a restored Peel tower which is currently being used as a dwelling house.
